intro: [WRONG START] COLDENIA NESIOTICA, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy surface that helps retain moisture. Coldenia nesiotica plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for native insects and birds.
